alert.note: Alert for Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 12:32AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following counties, Tolland and Windham, Massachusetts, including the following counties, Hampden, Middlesex, Norfolk and Worcester, and northern Rhode Island, including the following county, Providence. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1231 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Worcester, Framingham, Woonsocket, Leominster, Fitchburg, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Cumberland, Natick, Franklin, Vernon, Norwood, Milford, Stoughton, Mansfield, Windham, Plainfield, Walpole, Canton and Smithfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
